Edward Lee King (March 28, 1894 â€“ September 7, 1938) was a Major League Baseball outfielder. He started his career with the 1916 Philadelphia Athletics, for which he batted .188 in 42 games. He spent most of 1917 and 1919 playing for Springfield of the Eastern League.
